**Text:**

Dear Diary,

I found it today - his favorite mug, nestled amongst the others like a ghost from our past. It was stupid of me to think I could wash all our dishes without coming across it eventually. Now here it is, in my hands, cold and lifeless just like... him.

Why didn't he take it with him that day? Was it because he knew something was wrong? What if he tried to call out for help but couldn't? What if he suffered alone, afraid, wishing he'd said goodbye properly?

These questions swirl in my mind like a storm, each 'what if' darker than the last. I can't seem to make them stop. It's like trying to catch raindrops in a sieve - useless, exhausting.

I keep thinking about all the other mornings we had together. What if one of those days was our last? Would I have known it was goodbye forever? Or would it have been just another ordinary day, shattered into a million pieces sometime later?

The mug mocks me with its silence. It doesn't know what it's like to be left behind, wondering and worrying until my heart feels like it might break apart from the sheer weight of uncertainty.

I wish I could make these thoughts stop. But they're as much a part of me now as his memory is. And sometimes, I worry that one day they'll consume me entirely.
